house_prices.config module

Configuration file for the project.

class house_prices.config.ProjectConfig(*, num_features: list[str], cat_features: list[str], target: str, catalog_name: str, schema_name: str, parameters: dict[str, Any], experiment_name_basic: str | None, experiment_name_custom: str | None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Represent project configuration parameters loaded from YAML.

Handles feature specifications, catalog details, and experiment parameters. Supports environment-specific configuration overrides.

cat_features: list[str]
catalog_name: str
experiment_name_basic: str | None
experiment_name_custom: str | None
classmethod from_yaml(config_path: str, env: str = 'dev') → ProjectConfig[source]

Load and parse configuration settings from a YAML file.

Parameters:

  • config_path – Path to the YAML configuration file

  • env – Environment name to load environment-specific settings

Returns:

ProjectConfig instance initialized with parsed configuration

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[Dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[Dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'cat_features': FieldInfo(annotation=list[str], required=True), 'catalog_name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'experiment_name_basic': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[str, NoneType], required=True), 'experiment_name_custom': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[str, NoneType], required=True), 'num_features': FieldInfo(annotation=list[str], required=True), 'parameters': FieldInfo(annotation=dict[str, Any], required=True), 'schema_name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'target': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo] objects.

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

house_prices.data_processor module

Data preprocessing module.

class house_prices.data_processor.DataProcessor(pandas_df: DataFrame, config: ProjectConfig, spark: SparkSession)[source]

Bases: object

A class for preprocessing and managing DataFrame operations.

This class handles data preprocessing, splitting, and saving to Databricks tables.

enable_change_data_feed() → None[source]

Enable Change Data Feed for train and test set tables.

This method alters the tables to enable Change Data Feed functionality.

preprocess() → None[source]

Preprocess the DataFrame stored in self.df.

This method handles missing values, converts data types, and performs feature engineering.

save_to_catalog(train_set: DataFrame, test_set: DataFrame) → None[source]

Save the train and test sets into Databricks tables.

Parameters:

  • train_set – The training DataFrame to be saved.

  • test_set – The test DataFrame to be saved.

split_data(test_size: float = 0.2, random_state: int = 42) → tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame][source]

Split the DataFrame (self.df) into training and test sets.

Parameters:

  • test_size – The proportion of the dataset to include in the test split.

  • random_state – Controls the shuffling applied to the data before applying the split.

Returns:

A tuple containing the training and test DataFrames.

house_prices.utils module

Utility class.

house_prices.utils.adjust_predictions(predictions: ndarray, scale_factor: float = 1.3) → ndarray[source]

Adjust predictions by multiplying them with a scale factor.

Parameters:

  • predictions – Array of predictions to be adjusted

  • scale_factor – Factor to scale the predictions by

Returns:

Adjusted predictions array

House price package.

house_prices.get_version() → str[source]

Retrieve the version of the package.

This function attempts to read the version from the installed package, and if not found, reads it from a version.txt file.

Returns:

The version string of the package.
